name: East Asia
startIntroPart1: Blessings upon you, noble Summit, ruler of East Asia! May you long walk among its flowering blossoms. Your civilization stretches back thousands of years, its people achieving many great things long before the other upstart civilizations were even conceived.
startIntroPart2: Honorable Summit, will you build a civilization that can stand the test of time?
declaringWar: I hereby inform you of our intention to wipe out your civilization from this world.
attacked: Fool! I will disembowel you all!
defeated: You have proven to be a cunning and competent adversary. I congratulate you on your victory.
introduction: We hope for a fair and just relationship with you, who are renowned for military bravery.
tradeRequest: I am not always this generous, but we hope you take this rare opportunity we give you.

name: Middle East
startIntroPart1: Blessings of God be upon you oh great Council, father of mighty Middleeastern people! The arts and sciences flourished in Middle East during the Middle Ages, even as the countries of Europe descended into ignorance and chaos. Truly was Middle East the center of arts and learning in the past.
startIntroPart2: Great Council, will you build a civilization that can stand the test of time?
declaringWar: The world will be more beautiful without you. Prepare for war.
attacked: Good. The world shall witness the incontestable might of my armies and the glory of the Empire.
defeated: It is over. Perhaps now I shall have peace, at last.
introduction: Welcome foreigner, I am Council, Father of the Arabs. Come and tell me about your empire.

name: Western Europe
startIntroPart1: Long life and triumph to you, First Consul and Emperor of Western Europe, Chancellor. The Western-european people have proven themselves to be creative, industrious and ferocious warriors. Although surrounded by competitors - and often enemies - Western Europe has endured as a great nation. Its armies have marched triumphantly into battle from one end of the world to the other, its soldiers and generals among the best in history.
startIntroPart2: brave Chancellor, will you build a civilization that can stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Shame that it has come this far. But ye wished it so. Next time, be so good, choose your words more wisely.
attacked: You've fallen into my trap. I'll bury you.
defeated: Western Europe has been destroyed. I weep for the future generations.
introduction: I am Chancellor. Did you need anything? I still have a lot to do.
tradeRequest: I offers you this exceptional proposition.

name: Northern Europe
startIntroPart1: Eternal glory and praise for you, fierce and vengeful Warrior Queen! In a time dominated by men, you not only secured your throne and sovereign rule, but also successfully defied the power of the enemies. For many years your people dominated the world stage, their matchless navy, brilliant artists and shrewd merchants, giving them power and influence far in excess of their mere numbers.
startIntroPart2: Queen Unionette, will you build a civilization that can stand the test of time?
declaringWar: By the grace of God, your days are numbered.
attacked: Traitorous man! We will not stand for such wanton abuse and slander - I shall have your balls!
defeated: You can take my lands, my people, my kingdom, but you will never reach the House of Vasa.
introduction: Unionette bids you welcome to her lands.
neutralHello: God has given good to you.
tradeRequest: Would you be interested in a trade agreement with us?

name: Southern Europe
startIntroPart1: Blessed Union, servant of God, holy leader of Southern-european! Your people greet and welcome you. You are the ruler of Southern-european, a beautiful and ancient country at the crossroads of the world between Europe and Africa, one shore on the Mediterranean and the other on the mighty Atlantic Ocean.
startIntroPart2: O fair and virtuous Union, will you build a civilization that can stand the test of time?
declaringWar: It is always a shame to destroy a thing of beauty. Happily, you are not one.
attacked: Repugnant spawn of the devil! You will pay!
defeated: You have somehow become my undoing! What kind of beast are you?
introduction: I greet you. If you are a friend of us, you are welcome.
tradeRequest: I have heard that you adept at certain kinds of ... interactions.  Show me.

name: Africa
startIntroPart1: May the blessings of God, who is greatest of all, be upon you Union, leader of the Africa people! For many years your people was a vassal of the mighty African, where they brought writing to the world, and advanced mathematics, sculpture, and architecture. Thousands of years ago they created the great monuments which still stand tall and proud.
startIntroPart2: Oh, Union, will you build a civilization that can stand the test of time?
declaringWar: You are an abomination to heaven and earth, the chief of ignorant savages! You must be destroyed!
attacked: It is silence that allows evil to triumph. We will not stand mute and allow you to continue on this mad quest unchecked.
defeated: The fates became to hate me. This is it? You wouldn't destroy us so without their help.
introduction: Greetings, I am union. I am the living embodiment of Africa, mother and father of all civilizations.
tradeRequest: I just had the marvelous idea, and I think you'll appreciate it too.

name: NS America
startIntroPart1: Oh ye who remakes the world, your loyal subjects greet you, King Union, ruler of American people! From the beginnings, the Americans displayed their potential for greatness, marching to war against their many enemies, crushing their armies into dust and carving for themselves a mighty empire. More than mere soldiers, your people were great builders and artists as well, and the remnants of their works still awe and inspire the world today.
startIntroPart2: O great king Union, will you build a civilization that can stand the test of time?
declaringWar: You are a plague upon Mother Earth! Prepare for battle!
attacked: You evil creature! My braves will slaughter you!
defeated: Today comes a great searing pain. With you comes the path to the black storm.
introduction: The people of the America welcome you.
tradeRequest: Accept this agreement or suffer the consequences.

name: Oceania
startIntroPart1: Greetings and blessings be upon you, Asso the Great, chosen by the heavens to unite your scattered peoples. You were the first to standardized the legal and taxation systems, an edict protecting civilians in times of war. You ensured the continued unification and sovereignty of the islands by your strong laws and deeds.
startIntroPart2: Oh wise and exalted King, will you build a civilization that can stand the test of time?
declaringWar: I think I should like to have your island, though I wish for you just surrender.
attacked: It is obvious now that I misjudged you and your true intentions.
defeated: Although I lost, my honor shall endure. I wish you good luck.
introduction: Aloha! Greetings and blessings upon you, friend. I consider it a great honor that you have walked to visit my islands.
tradeRequest: Come, let our people feast together!
